slides.title: Welcome to Docker
slides.content:
# Introduction to Docker ğŸ³

Docker revolutionized how we **build**, **ship**, and **run** applications.

## What you'll learn:
- **Installation** - Getting Docker running
- **Commands** - run, build, exec, and more
- **Dockerfile** - Creating container images

> ğŸ’¡ **Fun Fact:** Docker was released in 2013 and has over 13 million developers using it worldwide!

## What is Docker?

Docker is a **containerization platform** that packages applications with their dependencies.

slides.title: Installing Docker
slides.content:
# Installing Docker ğŸ“¥

## Docker Desktop (Windows/macOS)

1. Download from [docker.com](https://docker.com)
2. Run installer
3. Start Docker Desktop
4. Verify installation

## Linux Installation

```bash
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install ca-certificates curl gnupg

# Add Docker's official GPG key
sudo install -m 0755 -d /etc/apt/keyrings
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | \
  sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg

# Set up repository
echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) \
  signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] \
  https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(. /etc/os-release && echo $VERSION_CODENAME) stable" | \
  sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

# Install Docker
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io

# Add user to docker group (avoid sudo)
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
```

## Verify Installation

```bash
docker --version
# Docker version 24.0.7, build afdd53b

docker run hello-world
# Hello from Docker!
```

slides.title: Docker Run Command
slides.content:
# docker run ğŸƒ

The `run` command creates and starts a container.

## Basic Usage

```bash
# Run a simple container
docker run hello-world

# Run and interact with container
docker run -it ubuntu bash

# Run in background (detached)
docker run -d nginx

# Run with port mapping
docker run -d -p 8080:80 nginx

# Run with name
docker run -d --name my-nginx -p 8080:80 nginx
```

## Common Options

| Option | Description | Example |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| `-d` | Detached mode | `docker run -d nginx` |
| `-it` | Interactive TTY | `docker run -it ubuntu` |
| `-p` | Port mapping | `-p 8080:80` |
| `--name` | Container name | `--name my-app` |
| `-e` | Environment var | `-e NODE_ENV=prod` |
| `-v` | Volume mount | `-v /data:/app/data` |
| `--rm` | Remove on exit | `docker run --rm ubuntu` |

## Full Example

```bash
docker run -d \
  --name web-server \
  -p 8080:80 \
  -e NGINX_HOST=localhost \
  -v ./html:/usr/share/nginx/html \
  nginx:latest
```

slides.title: Container Management
slides.content:
# Managing Containers ğŸ“¦

## Listing Containers

```bash
# List running containers
docker ps

# List all containers (including stopped)
docker ps -a

# List with formatted output
docker ps --format "{{.ID}}\t{{.Names}}\t{{.Status}}"
```

## Container Lifecycle

```bash
# Start a stopped container
docker start container_name

# Stop a running container
docker stop container_name

# Restart a container
docker restart container_name

# Pause/unpause
docker pause container_name
docker unpause container_name

# Remove a container
docker rm container_name

# Force remove running container
docker rm -f container_name

# Remove all stopped containers
docker container prune
```

slides.title: Docker Exec Command
slides.content:
# docker exec ğŸ”§

Execute commands inside **running** containers.

## Basic Usage

```bash
# Run a command
docker exec container_name ls -la

# Interactive shell
docker exec -it container_name bash

# Run as specific user
docker exec -u root container_name whoami

# Set environment variable
docker exec -e MY_VAR=value container_name printenv

# Set working directory
docker exec -w /app container_name pwd
```

## Common Use Cases

### Debug a Running Container
```bash
# Access shell
docker exec -it my-app bash

# Check processes
docker exec my-app ps aux

# View files
docker exec my-app cat /var/log/app.log

# Check network
docker exec my-app netstat -tulpn
```

### Database Operations
```bash
# MySQL shell
docker exec -it mysql-container mysql -u root -p

# PostgreSQL shell
docker exec -it postgres-container psql -U postgres

# MongoDB shell
docker exec -it mongo-container mongosh
```

## Exec Options

| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| `-i` | Keep STDIN open |
| `-t` | Allocate pseudo-TTY |
| `-d` | Detached mode |
| `-e` | Set environment variable |
| `-u` | Username or UID |
| `-w` | Working directory |

slides.title: Docker Build Command
slides.content:
# docker build ğŸ—ï¸

Create images from a **Dockerfile**.

## Basic Build

```bash
# Build in current directory
docker build .

# Build with tag
docker build -t my-app:1.0 .

# Build with specific Dockerfile
docker build -f Dockerfile.prod -t my-app:prod .

# Build with build arguments
docker build --build-arg VERSION=1.0 -t my-app .

# Build without cache
docker build --no-cache -t my-app .
```

## Build Options

| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| `-t, --tag` | Name and tag |
| `-f, --file` | Dockerfile path |
| `--build-arg` | Build-time variables |
| `--no-cache` | Don't use cache |
| `--target` | Build specific stage |
| `--platform` | Target platform |

## Build Context

```bash
# Current directory as context
docker build .

# Specific directory
docker build /path/to/context

# Git URL as context
docker build https://github.com/user/repo.git
```

## .dockerignore

Exclude files from build context:

```
node_modules
.git
*.log
.env
Dockerfile
.dockerignore
```

slides.title: Dockerfile Basics
slides.content:
# Dockerfile Fundamentals ğŸ“

A Dockerfile contains **instructions** to build an image.

## Basic Structure

```dockerfile
# Base image
FROM node:20-alpine

# Maintainer info (optional)
LABEL maintainer="you@example.com"

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Copy dependency files
COPY package*.json ./

# Install dependencies
RUN npm ci --only=production

# Copy application code
COPY . .

# Expose port
EXPOSE 3000

# Set environment variable
ENV NODE_ENV=production

# Define startup command
CMD ["node", "server.js"]
```

## Common Instructions

| Instruction | Purpose |
|-------------|--------|
| `FROM` | Base image |
| `WORKDIR` | Set working directory |
| `COPY` | Copy files to image |
| `ADD` | Copy files (with extraction) |
| `RUN` | Execute command during build |
| `CMD` | Default command to run |
| `ENTRYPOINT` | Configure as executable |
| `ENV` | Set environment variable |
| `EXPOSE` | Document port |
| `VOLUME` | Create mount point |

slides.title: Dockerfile Best Practices
slides.content:
# Dockerfile Best Practices âœ…

## 1. Order Instructions by Change Frequency

```dockerfile
# âœ… Good - rarely changing first
FROM node:20-alpine
WORKDIR /app

# Dependencies (changes less often)
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci

# Code (changes frequently)
COPY . .

CMD ["npm", "start"]
```

## 2. Minimize Layers

```dockerfile
# âŒ Bad - multiple RUN commands
RUN apt-get update
RUN apt-get install -y curl
RUN apt-get install -y wget

# âœ… Good - combined
RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y curl wget && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
```

## 3. Use Specific Tags

```dockerfile
# âŒ Bad
FROM node:latest

# âœ… Good
FROM node:20.10-alpine3.18
```

## 4. Use Non-Root User

```dockerfile
FROM node:20-alpine

# Create non-root user
RUN addgroup -g 1001 appgroup && \
    adduser -u 1001 -G appgroup -D appuser

WORKDIR /app
COPY --chown=appuser:appgroup . .

USER appuser
CMD ["npm", "start"]
```

## 5. Use .dockerignore

```
node_modules
.git
*.md
Dockerfile
.dockerignore
```

slides.title: Image Management
slides.content:
# Managing Images ğŸ–¼ï¸

## Listing Images

```bash
# List all images
docker images

# List with specific format
docker images --format "{{.Repository}}:{{.Tag}} {{.Size}}"

# Filter images
docker images --filter "dangling=true"
```

## Pulling and Pushing

```bash
# Pull from registry
docker pull nginx:latest
docker pull ubuntu:22.04

# Tag an image
docker tag my-app:latest myregistry.com/my-app:1.0

# Push to registry
docker push myregistry.com/my-app:1.0

# Login to registry
docker login myregistry.com
```

## Cleaning Up

```bash
# Remove specific image
docker rmi nginx:latest

# Remove unused images
docker image prune

# Remove all unused images
docker image prune -a

# System-wide cleanup
docker system prune -a
```

## Inspecting Images

```bash
# View image details
docker inspect nginx:latest

# View image history (layers)
docker history nginx:latest

# View image size
docker images nginx --format "{{.Size}}"
```

slides.title: Logs and Debugging
slides.content:

```bash

# Follow logs in real-time

# Show last N lines

# Show logs since timestamp
docker logs --since 2024-01-01T00:00:00 container_name

# Show timestamps
docker logs -t container_name
```

## Debugging Commands

```bash
# Inspect container details
docker inspect container_name

# View resource usage
docker stats container_name

# View running processes
docker top container_name

# View port mappings
docker port container_name

# View file changes
docker diff container_name
```

slides.title: Environment Variables
slides.content:
# Environment Variables ğŸ”§

## Passing Variables

```bash
# Single variable
docker run -e MY_VAR=value nginx

# Multiple variables
docker run -e VAR1=value1 -e VAR2=value2 nginx

# From shell environment
export MY_SECRET=secret123
docker run -e MY_SECRET nginx

# From env file
docker run --env-file ./env.list nginx
```

## Environment File

```env
# env.list
DATABASE_HOST=localhost
DATABASE_PORT=5432
DATABASE_USER=admin
DATABASE_PASSWORD=secret
NODE_ENV=production
```

## In Dockerfile

```dockerfile
# Set default value
ENV NODE_ENV=production
ENV PORT=3000

# Multiple in one line
ENV APP_NAME=myapp \
    APP_VERSION=1.0

# Use in commands
RUN echo "Building for $NODE_ENV"
```

## Build Arguments

```dockerfile
# Define argument
ARG VERSION=latest

# Use in image tag
FROM node:${VERSION}

# Convert to env var
ARG NODE_ENV
ENV NODE_ENV=${NODE_ENV:-production}
```

```bash
docker build --build-arg VERSION=20 --build-arg NODE_ENV=development .
```

slides.title: Port Mapping
slides.content:
# Port Mapping ğŸ”Œ

## Exposing Ports

```bash
# Map host:container port
docker run -p 8080:80 nginx

# Map multiple ports
docker run -p 8080:80 -p 443:443 nginx

# Map to specific host interface
docker run -p 127.0.0.1:8080:80 nginx

# Random host port
docker run -p 80 nginx
docker port container_name  # See assigned port

# Map all exposed ports
docker run -P nginx
```

## Port Syntax

```
-p HOST_PORT:CONTAINER_PORT
-p HOST_IP:HOST_PORT:CONTAINER_PORT
-p HOST_PORT:CONTAINER_PORT/udp
```

## In Dockerfile

```dockerfile
# Document exposed ports
EXPOSE 80
EXPOSE 443
EXPOSE 3000/udp
```

> âš ï¸ **Note:** `EXPOSE` is documentation only - ports are not published automatically!

## Viewing Port Mappings

```bash
# Show all port mappings
docker port container_name
# 80/tcp -> 0.0.0.0:8080

# In docker ps output
docker ps
# PORTS: 0.0.0.0:8080->80/tcp
```

slides.title: Multi-Stage Builds
slides.content:
# Multi-Stage Builds ğŸ­

Create **smaller** production images by using multiple build stages.

## Without Multi-Stage (Large Image)

```dockerfile
FROM node:20
WORKDIR /app
COPY . .
RUN npm ci
RUN npm run build
# Image includes ALL dev dependencies!
CMD ["npm", "start"]
```

## With Multi-Stage (Small Image)

```dockerfile
# Stage 1: Build
FROM node:20 AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

# Stage 2: Production
FROM node:20-alpine
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci --only=production
COPY --from=builder /app/dist ./dist
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["node", "dist/server.js"]
```

## Size Comparison

```
Without multi-stage:  1.2 GB
With multi-stage:     150 MB
Reduction:            87%
```

## Build Specific Stage

```bash
# Build only the builder stage
docker build --target builder -t my-app:dev .
```

> ğŸ¯ **Best Practice:** Always use multi-stage builds for production!

slides.title: Docker Cheat Sheet
slides.content:
# Docker Commands Cheat Sheet ğŸ“‹

## Container Commands

```bash
# Run
docker run -d -p 80:80 --name web nginx
docker run -it ubuntu bash

# Lifecycle
docker start/stop/restart container
docker rm container
docker rm -f container  # Force

# Information
docker ps / docker ps -a
docker logs container
docker exec -it container bash
docker inspect container
```

## Image Commands

```bash
# Build
docker build -t app:1.0 .

# Registry
docker pull image:tag
docker push image:tag
docker tag old:tag new:tag

# Management
docker images
docker rmi image
docker image prune
```

## Cleanup Commands

```bash
# Remove stopped containers
docker container prune

# Remove unused images
docker image prune -a

# Remove unused volumes
docker volume prune

# Remove everything unused
docker system prune -a --volumes
```

## Useful Flags

| Flag | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| `-d` | Detached mode |
| `-it` | Interactive TTY |
| `-p` | Port mapping |
| `-v` | Volume mount |
| `-e` | Environment variable |
| `--name` | Container name |
| `--rm` | Remove on exit |

slides.title: Real-World Example
slides.content:
# Complete Example: Node.js App ğŸš€

## Dockerfile

```dockerfile
# Build stage
FROM node:20-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app

# Install dependencies
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci

# Build application
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

# Production stage
FROM node:20-alpine
WORKDIR /app

# Create non-root user
RUN addgroup -g 1001 nodejs && \
    adduser -u 1001 -G nodejs -D nodejs

# Install production dependencies only
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci --only=production && npm cache clean --force

# Copy built assets
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodejs:nodejs /app/dist ./dist

# Switch to non-root user
USER nodejs

# Expose port and set command
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["node", "dist/server.js"]
```

## Build and Run

```bash
# Build
docker build -t my-node-app:1.0 .

# Run
docker run -d \
  --name my-app \
  -p 3000:3000 \
  -e NODE_ENV=production \
  my-node-app:1.0

# Verify
curl http://localhost:3000
```
